item.title: Katie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Katie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Katie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Be not afraid of greatness. Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Katie add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind, And therefore is winged Cupid painted blind." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Katie add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "Where there is great love, there are always miracles." -- Willa Cather

item.title: Katie add a quote by Sir Francis Bacon
item.description: "Some books should be tasted, some devoured, but only a few should be chewed and digested thoroughly." -- Sir Francis Bacon

item.title: Katie add a quote by Kathryn Stockett
item.description: "You is kind. You is smart. You is important." -- Kathryn Stockett

item.title: Katie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Katie add a quote by Dieter F. Uchtdorf
item.description: "In the end, the number of prayers we say may contribute to our happiness, but the number of prayers we answer may be of even greater importance." -- Dieter F. Uchtdorf

item.title: Katie add a quote by David O Mckay
item.description: "The purpose of the gospel is to make bad men good and good men better, and to change human nature." -- David O Mckay
